result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Scott E. Hopinkah was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pursuant to Wis. Stat 973.05(4)(b), restitution, costs, and surcharges are to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Judge ordered no DNA surcharge be assessed.
Must seek and maintain full-time employment which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  You must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin without prior approval of agent, must be properly licensed, and vehicle must have IID installed.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Must comply with any other recommendations for programming.  By Order of the Court, defendant is to be placed into the Substance Abuse Program as quickly as possible.

supervisions.notes: Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.

Amended 12-22-15:  Attorney fees of $1365.00 assessed with money paid on file of $34.00 applied, leaving a balance due of $1331.00.  Attorney fees are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts Office not through DOC.  Defendant should come in and set up a payment plan immediately upon release from prison.

records.addlTxt: 1 -4 Letters

Defendant appears with counsel James Ritland.  DA Fox appears for the State.  No errors or omissions in PSI noted by DA.  Attorney Ritland notes that on page 12 it references restitution.  He states there is no restitution issue in this case. State recommends mandatory minimum of 3 yrs initial confinement with 3 yrs extended supervision, with SAP eligible.  Conditionsof ES:  No alc, available for testing, no access to vecicle unless agent consents, must have IID, must be licensed.  Recommends lowest fine.  Judge states that attorney Ritland had previously had some letters marked as exhibits 1-4 in support of defendant.  No objection to receive exhibits.  Exhibits 1-4 are received and made part of the record.  Atty Ritland recommends probation with in-patient alcohol treatment; jail term.  If prison ordered requests ERP.  Also requests time as he has some medical issues to address.  Request sentence to begin in 60 days.  DA Fox states the Court cannot stay a prison sentence, would have to adjourn sentencing.  DA Fox leaves decision to adjourn up to the Court.  Defendant makes a statement to the Court.  Court orders on Count 1:  3 years initial confinement with 3 years extended supervision with credit for 5 days served; eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  Court orders that DOC should place into SAP as quickly as possible.   ES conditions ordered:  AODA assessment &must comply with all recommendations; not to consume any alcohol; not to be where sold/served/available; must seek and maintain FT employment, and may not leave employment w/o agent's prior approval; no operation of mv unless agent agrees; must be licensed;  vehicle must have IID; costs of action; fine is $500 plus costs; no DNA surcharge ordered; comply with any other programming as recommended by agent.  Court ordered a driver's license revocation of 2 years and  IID for 2 years.  DOC sentence to begin at noon today.  5 days sentence credit granted.  Sentence to begin at noon today.
Paper copies to the attorneys.  E-mailed to Judge.  JMM
pretrial motions heard in chambers.

1 - Lab Report
2 - Officer's Report, page 7 only

Defendant appears with counsel James Ritland.  Gerald Fox appears for the State. Motion hearing held in chambers prior to trial.   Voir dire oath given to entire panel at 9:00.  Voir dire of panel follows.  Court performed, DA Fox and Attorney Ritland thereafter.  Voir Dire completed at 9:55 am.  Strikes exercised. Jurors sworn.  State made motion to sequester witnesses.  Granted.  Answer to number of defendant's prior convictions remains as 2.  Attorney Ritland requests early instructions.  Recess 10:10.  Resume @ 10:25 am.  Court gives preliminary jury instructions to the jurors.  DA Fox gave opening statement. Attorney Ritland gave opening statement.  State called Sgt.. E.M., sworn by clerk.  Education, employment and training testified to.  Standardized field sobriety testing training, certification and tests explained.  Alternate testing described.  Witness was on patrol 2/19/14 at approximately 11:43 pm.   Witness described what he heard and saw.  Witness identified the defendant.  Record reflects the identification.  HGN test performed first.  6 clues observed.  Alphabet test given.  Counting test given.  Lack of convergence test performed twice. Modified Rombert test performed.  Exhibit 1 marked by plaintiff -  Lab Test - Offered and received.  Witness continues to testify.  Defense marks Exhibit 2 - Officer's Report, page 7 - witness reviews exhibit and testifies to exhibit.  Exhibit 2 made part of the file but not received.  Witness steps down.  State rests.  Defense calls witness. J.P., sworn, testifies.  Defense calls witness, V.W., sworn, testifies.  Break for lunch at 11:50; to return at 1:00.  Jury out.  Defense counsel will discuss with defendant during lunch if his client will testify or not.  Defense moves to dismiss.  Motion is denied.  Defense makes motion there is no need for 2 charges in this case.  State makes his argument for 2 charges.  Court denies motion. Back on record at 12:52 with jury out.  Defendant will not testify.  Judge does colloquy of defendant regarding testifying.  Judge makes finding the defendant knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily decides not to testify.  Defense now rests.  Jury instruction conference completed with changes noted and agreed upon.  Jurors back in and on the record at 1:30.  Closing instructions begin.  Closing arguments begin at 1:47 and end at 2:02.  Final instructions completed at 2:06.  Alternate announced and excused.  Jury out to deliberate at 2:08.  Jury returns verdicts of guilty to both Count 1 & Count 2 at 2:23.  Defense requests the jury be polled - all answered yes those are their verdicts as read.  DA requests judgment be entered as guilty on Count 1; not remand to jail as no known violations; request PSI.  Finding of guilty on Count 1 with Count 2 dimissed.  Pre-sentence investigation ordered and is due within 45 days, at least 10 days prior to sentencing date.  Bond is continued.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on M.G. from Crime Laboratory - Wausau to appear on October 30, 2015 at the jury trial.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Deputy E. M. to appear on October 30, 2015 at the jury trial.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  Intoxication defense.  Attorney Ritland wishes to add to jury instructions.  Attorney Ritland will provide objections to State's filings of today within 1 week.  State's Motion in Liminie.  Impeachment of defendant.  Attorney Ritland objects to 1993 and 1996 and 1997.  Not relevant, not recent.   DA Fox wants answer to be yes, and 7.  Court rules:  answer yes, and 2.   Attorney Riland discusses his request for  jury instruction regarding "attempt".  DA Fox argues against.  Court will revisit at jury trial.

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Must be equipped with a SCRAM unit before release. AMNEDED 3-12-2014; scram may be removed, must report to Jackson County Sheriff Department to report to alcohol testing kiosk at random times to be determined by Jackson County Sheriff's Department. You are to report within 2 hours for testing after being contacted by Jackson County Sheriff's Department. All other conditions remain.

Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Must be equipped with a SCRAM unit before release. You are to report within 2 hours for testing after being contacted by Jackson County Sheriff's Department. All other conditions remain.

Scott called wondered if an atty had been appt yet; also explained he had to pay $400 to get out of jail on a SCRAM unit and he was lead to believe in court that he did not have to pay for that until he is convicted of the crime. Explained to him when he finds out who his atty is explain all that to them to bring up before the court.
Sent to Judge
